verses.plain: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.

tokens.t: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.

verses.plain: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?

tokens.t: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?

verses.plain: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.

tokens.t: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.

verses.plain: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:

tokens.t: not for kings, O Lemuel,
not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:

verses.plain: Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.

tokens.t: Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.

verses.plain: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.

tokens.t: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.

verses.plain: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

tokens.t: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

verses.plain: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.

tokens.t: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.

verses.plain: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.

tokens.t: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.

verses.plain: ¶ Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.

tokens.t: ¶ Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price
far above rubies.

verses.plain: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.

tokens.t: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.

verses.plain: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.

tokens.t: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.

verses.plain: She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.

tokens.t: She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.

verses.plain: She is like the merchants’ ships; she bringeth her food from afar.

tokens.t: She is like the merchants’ ships; she bringeth her food from afar.

verses.plain: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.

tokens.t: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.

verses.plain: She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

tokens.t: She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

verses.plain: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.

tokens.t: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.

verses.plain: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.

tokens.t: She perceiveth that her merchandise
good: her candle goeth not out by night.

verses.plain: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.

tokens.t: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.

verses.plain: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

tokens.t: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

verses.plain: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

tokens.t: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household
clothed with scarlet.

verses.plain: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.

tokens.t: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing
silk and purple.

verses.plain: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.

tokens.t: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.

verses.plain: She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

tokens.t: She maketh fine linen, and selleth
and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

verses.plain: Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.

tokens.t: Strength and honour
her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.

verses.plain: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.

tokens.t: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue
the law of kindness.

verses.plain: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.

tokens.t: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.

verses.plain: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.

tokens.t: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband
, and he praiseth her.

verses.plain: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.

tokens.t: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.

verses.plain: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.

tokens.t: Favour
deceitful, and beauty
vain:
a woman
feareth the
, she shall be praised.

verses.plain: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.

tokens.t: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.

footnotes.text: of any…: Heb. of all the sons of affliction
such…: Heb. the sons of destruction
